meanings.sent1: After searching for hours, I finally refound my lost keys under the couch.
meanings.sent2: I refound my favorite book on the shelf where I had left it.
meanings.sent3: I refound my missing sock in the refrigerator - what a silly place for it to hide!
meanings.sent4: Her smile refound its way back to her face after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph refound memories of a happy summer long ago.

meanings.definition: To establish or set up again.
meanings.sent1: The community worked together to refound the local library after it closed down.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to refound their strategy for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: They had to refound the tent multiple times before getting it right.
meanings.sent4: The artist refound her passion for painting after a long break.
meanings.sent5: The sun refound its place in the sky after the storm passed.

meanings.sent1: I will refound the borrowed book to the library tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She promised to refound the money she borrowed from her friend.
meanings.sent3: The kind gesture was refound with a grateful smile.
meanings.sent4: The lost dog was refound to its owner by a good Samaritan.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map refound the adventurers to the buried chest.
